Felix' Blog

A blog about programming, science, and everything else that I might come up with

About

My name is Felix, I’ve got a diploma in computer science from the TU Dresden, Germany, and I’m currently doing my PhD in Neuroscience.

I learned C when I was 16 years old and adopted to C++ shortly after that. As a student, I had a research assistant position for 2 years where I wrote different programs in C++ for video recording, compression, and some lightweight analysis. During my intern semester, I developed a tool to ease analysis of electrical signals in animal nerves, and implemented a couple of time series analysis algorithms. During different practical works in the course of my study I worked a lot with Python, which I also have been using in my diploma thesis, and since in my PhD.

My interests evolve a lot around improving as a programmer, including learning cool new techniques, libraries and tools. Additionally, I’m interested in machine learning (especially in algorithms that work well with small samples) and statistics.

You can find me at GitHub or write me an e-mail:
